alert.note: Alert for Northern Virginia Blue Ridge (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Baltimore/Washington (Washington D.C., Central Maryland, Northern Virginia, Eastern West Virginia)
info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued December 22 at 2:55PM EST until December 22 at 4:00PM EST by NWS Baltimore/Washington
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 4 PM EST THIS AFTERNOON... ...WIND CHILL WARNING IN EFFECT FROM 6 AM FRIDAY TO 10 AM EST SATURDAY... * WHAT...For the Wind Chill Warning, dangerously cold wind chills expected; wind chills as low as 30 below zero. For the Winter Weather Advisory, mixed precipitation; additional snow accumulations of less than one inch and ice accumulations of a light glaze. * WHERE...Northern Virginia Blue Ridge. * WHEN...For the Wind Chill Warning, from 6 AM Friday to 10 AM EST Saturday. For the Winter Weather Advisory, until 4 PM EST this afternoon. * IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions. The hazardous conditions will impact holiday travel. Strong winds could cause damage to trees and power lines. The cold wind chills could cause frostbite on exposed skin in as little as 5 minutes. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...For the Wind Chill Warning, the highest wind speeds will be Friday into Friday evening. Affects from the extreme cold could be made worse due to power outages.
info.instruction: Avoid outside activities if possible. When outside, make sure you wear appropriate clothing, a hat, and gloves. Slow down and use caution while traveling.
